author: Staff Reporter
text:
Condemning the Central Government’s rule of logging PAN cards for all transactions abover Rs. 2 lakh, jewellery shop owners downed their shutters here on Thursday.

They said that the business is already facing uncertainty due to various factors and making PAN card mandatory for the purchase would affect them and workers involved in the trade. They urged the government to increase the norms from Rs. 2 lakh to Rs. 10 lakh.

However, in Namakkal district more than 700 jewellery shops functioned as usual. Most of the shops were opened in Tiruchengode, Rasipuram and Namakkal areas are the business was as usual.
title: Jewellers down shutters in Salem opposing PAN card rule
